document_data.caption: Teth'ka under the effects of the [[speak with the dead]] spell.
document_data.name: Teth'ka
document_data.mainbody:
'''Teth'ka''' was a [[githyanki]] warrior in training from [[Crèche Y'llek]], on [[Toril]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Shameful death... dishonor to [[Vlaakith]]...|Teth'ka}}
document_data.Description: Teth'ka had a gaunt gith body and long light brown hair. She wore a set of githyanki-crafted [[half plate]].
document_data.History: Teth'ka's people, the gith group that would become Crèche Y'llek, attacked and claimed the [[Rosymorn Monastery]] of [[Lathander]] in the [[Western Heartlands]] of [[West Faerûn]] sometime before the {{YearlinkName|1492}}. Soon after, the function of Crèche was changed as the githyanki war against the [[mind flayer]]s in [[Faerûn]] shifted in balance. Teth'ka, loyal to her Kith'tak, was a warrior in training who was to become a sarth, leading her kin into battle. She and several of her kin ventured into the nearby [[shadow-cursed lands]], where they encountered a corrupted spirit of nature [[Thaniel]] who forced them to play games with him and his shadows and ended up killing Teth'ka and others.
